references.reason: This is a foundational textbook in reinforcement learning, providing a comprehensive overview of the field and its core concepts.

references.paper_title: Mastering the game of Go with deep neural networks and tree search
references.reason: This paper demonstrates a significant breakthrough in artificial intelligence by showcasing the success of deep reinforcement learning in mastering the complex game of Go.
This paper addresses a fundamental question in reinforcement learning, providing theoretical analysis and insights into the efficiency of Q-learning algorithms.

references.paper_title: Model-based RL in contextual decision processes: PAC bounds and exponential improvements over model-free approaches
references.reason: This paper offers a theoretical comparison of model-based and model-free reinforcement learning algorithms, highlighting the advantages of model-based methods under certain conditions.
This paper introduces a novel policy gradient method that is provably efficient and has found widespread applications in various reinforcement learning settings.
